datafield.subfield: Title from inscription on front flyleaf:
حاشية شاه حسين على الحاشية الحسينية
198 x 115 (147 x 55) mm. bound to 198 x 120 mm.
Shelfmark: Ann Arbor, University of Michigan, Special Collections Library, Isl. Ms. 117

Origin: As appears in colophon on p.113-114, copied by Maḥmūd ibn Ḥājjī Muḥammad (Mahmut bin Hacı Mehmet) in the medrese of the Nişancı Mehmet Paşa complex in Istanbul. Transcription of the first work finished in Dhū al-Qaʻdah 1083 [February-March 1673]. As appears on p.127, transcription of second work finished 1083 [February-March 1673]. Colophon on p.196 is quite difficult to make out, but seems to indicate that transcription of final work was completed in 1084 [1673 or 1674]. Paper certainly suggests 17th century.
Former shelfmark: British Museum, London "No. 153. Tracts on dialectics."

Binding: Pasteboards covered in laid marbled paper (blue and white) with spine, fore-edge flap, and edges/turn-ins in red-brown leather ; Type II binding (with flap) ; board linings in laid paper ; sewn in pink thread, two stations, with primaries in yellow ; only traces of worked endbands remain ; overall in poor condition with significant abrasion, staining, some lifting and losses of leather (particularly at fore-edge flap), delamination of boards, fore-edge flap detaching at lower cover, etc.

Support: European laid paper with 9 laid lines per cm. (vertical) and chain lines spaced 26 mm. apart (horizontal) ; paschal lamb in four-lobed circle watermark [compare Piccard inv. J 340/no. 86802 / (Venice, 1662), Heawood 2840 (Verona, 1678), Piccard inv. J 340/no. 86801 (Innsbruck, 1625)] ; fairly sturdy and well-burnished ; some staining.
Decoration: Keywords and abbreviations rubricated ; overlining in red ; crude rectangular 'headpiece' in red ink above opening on p.4 ; written area surrounded by red rule-border.

Script: Naskh-nastaʻlīq ; virtually serifless ; mainly closed counters ; slight effect of words descending to baseline ; final words/letters of line often superscript ; exaggerated thickness of horizontal strokes.
Layout: Written in 21 lines per page ; frame-ruled.

Collation: i, 3 V(30), VI (42), IV (50), III (56), 2 V(76), VII (90), V-1 (99) ; final two leaves originally left blank ; catchwords present ; pagination in pencil, Western numerals, supplied during digitization (includes front flyleaf).

Colophon: "Scribal," rectangular then triangular, reads: "تم هذه الحاشية الشريفة على يد العبد الضعيف المفتقر الى رحمة العافي ... محمود بن حاجي محمد ... في مدرسة نشان جى پاشا في قسطنطنية في وقت الضحى اوقات في شهر ذي القعدة سنة ثلث وثمانين والف الحمد لله على التمام والصلوة والسلام على محمد سيد الانام ... تم تم تم سنة ۱٨٣٠ [١٠٨٣] ; "Scribal," triangular, reads: "تمت سنة ۱۸٣٠ [١٠٨٣] تاريخ سنة ثلثة ثمانين والف" ; "Scribal," triangular, reads: "تم الكتاب بعون الملك الوهاب والمحمد بتاريخ ستة وثمانين ... والف سنة [؟] سنة ١٨٤٠ [١٠٨٤]"
Explicit: "و بما يحصل المقصود كما مر في الشق الاول من الشرديد [؟]"

Incipit: [Shāh Ḥusayn ʻalá Qarah Ḥāshiyah] "قوله سلك طريق الخ اعلم ان من دأب المصنفين ان يبتدأوا في اول تصانيفهم بكلام مشتمل على لفظ الحمد ..." ; [Qarah Ḥāshiyah] "الحمد لله الذي لا مانع لعطائه ..." ; [] "الحمد لله رب العالمين والصلوة على رسوله محمد واله اجمعين وبعد فقد قال الامام المحقق ... شمس الملة والدين محمد السمرقندي المنة علينا من من عليه لواهب ..."
Title supplied by cataloguer from inscription on front flyleaf (p.1).
4. p.128-p.196 : [al-Masʻūdī] / Kamāl al-Dīn Masʻūd al-Shirwānī al-Rūmī.
3. p.116-p.127 : [Qarah Ḥāshiyah] / ʻImād al-Dīn Yaḥyá al-Kāshī.
1. p.4-p.114 : Shāh Ḥusayn ʻalá Qarah Ḥāshiyah / ʻAbd al-Laṭīf Shāh Ḥusayn al-ʻAjamī.
Ghulāmī Muqaddam, BarātʻAlī. Fihrist-i kutub-i khaṭṭi-i Kitābʻkhānah-i Markazī-i Āstān-i Quds-i Raz̤avī : jild-i bīst va chahārum, manṭiq. Mashhad, 1383 [2004 or 5].

Fine copy of a supergloss on a gloss by ʻImād al-Dīn Yaḥyá al-Kāshī (ca.1350) upon the commentary by Kamāl al-Dīn Masʻūd al-Shirwānī al-Rūmī (d.1499) on al-Samarqandī's (13th c.) treatise on disputation, Risālah fī ādāb al-baḥth. Followed by the text of al-Kāshī's gloss and al-Shirwānī's commentary.
Acquired by purchase along with Abdul Hamid Collection (funds donated by Horace Rackham).

Bookplate of British Museum, London on interior of upper cover, "British Museum, London. No. 153. Tracts on dialectics." ; circular seal impression with figure of goat/gazelle in purple ink as well as inscription "415" in Western numerals on front flyleaf (p.1) ; on 'title page' (p.3) traces of ownership statement accompanied by oval seal impression, both now struck-through and obscured ; also on 'title page' (p.3) ownership statement in name of one Aḥmad ibn Muṣṭafá ibn Aḥmad known as Dīvānī (Ahmet bin Mustafa bin Ahmet Divani) accompanied by octagonal seal impression ("عبده احمد ..."), statement reads "من ممتلكات الفقير اليه عز شانه السيد احمد بن مصطفى بن احمد الشهير بديوانى [دلوانى؟] بارضروم عفي عنهم" ; on paper (blue-tinted) pasted on 'title page' (p.3), a detailed waqf statement in the name of al-Sayyid ʻAbd Allāh Adīb (Abdullah Edip), known as Jannatʹzādah (Cennet-zade), qāḍī of Erzurum, accompanied by his seal, reads: "وقفت وقفا صحيحا شرعيا على ان لا يخرج من بيت الكتب الملتصق بداري الا لعلماء سكنوا بارضروم بكفيل مرعى اورهن قوي وانا الفقير اليه عز شانه السيد عبد الله اديب الشهير بجنت زاده القاضي بمدينة ارضروم في سنة اثنى وستين ومائتين والف" ; a few glosses and marginal corrections.
Ahmet bin Mustafa bin Ahmet Divani,
احمد بن مصطفى بن احمد ديوانى،
غلامى مقدم، براتعلى. فهرست كتب خطى كتابخانه مركزى آسات قدسى رضوى : جلد بيست و چهارم، منطق. مشهد، ۱۳۸۳.
